intro: Neltuma hassleri, commonly known as the Hassler's neltuma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
